question_sentence: A "de-extinction" start-up claims it has revived a prehistoric species of which animal?
evidence: Colossal Biosciences said it had used DNA from prehistoric fossils to resurrect the dire wolf, a species that went extinct 10,000 years ago. But scientists have cast doubt on the claim, saying the company had merely created modern grey wolf cubs with traits modified to resemble the dire wolf.

question_sentence: What word did Donald Trump use to describe his tariffs policy that sent shockwaves through global financial markets?
evidence: Markets in Europe and Asia plunged on Monday, continuing last week’s global sell-off after President Trump imposed 10% tariffs on most imports. Trump defended the move, saying: "Sometimes you have to take medicine to fix something."

question_sentence: A bin strike in which English city is now in its fifth week?
evidence: Birmingham City Council declared a major incident on 31 March over the environmental and health dangers posed by its ongoing industrial dispute with the city's bin workers. Members of the Unite union have been on strike since 11 March, creating a backlog of waste estimated to be growing by 1,000 tonnes a week.

question_sentence: Which airline carrier announced it will begin assisting with the US' deportation efforts?
evidence: The low-cost airline is facing a boycott after announcing it had struck a deal with the Department of Homeland Security's Immigration and Customs Enforcement to assist with deportation efforts. The flights are set to begin on 12 May.

question_sentence: The Masters got under way this week in Augusta, Georgia, with which golfer favoured to win the famous tournament?
evidence: The 28-year-old from New Jersey won last year's Masters and is hoping to repeat his success this week in Augusta – with bookies rating Northern Ireland's Rory McIlroy as his most serious challenger. Golfing legends Jack Nicklaus, Gary Player and Tom Watson hit ceremonial tee shots to open the annual tournament, the first men's major of the year.

question_sentence: Ukraine's military captured soldiers from which nation fighting alongside Russian forces in the eastern Donetsk region?
evidence: Ukraine's military captured two Chinese troops in Donetsk, raising concerns that more Chinese citizens are joining Russia's war. This discovery calls into question China's desire for peace, as China and Russia did not immediately respond to Ukraine's "first official allegation" that Beijing is "supplying Russia with manpower".

question_sentence: What is the most popular name among candidates in the UK's upcoming local elections?
evidence: There will be 257s Davids or Daves on the ballot next month, accounting for 3% of all candidates, according to an analysis of electoral data. All but two of the 30 most common names were male, with Sarah and Jane the only women's names to make the list.

question_sentence: Scientists have created a 3D map of which animal's brain?
evidence: A group of 150 researchers created a 3D map of the 84,000 neurons in a mouse's brain, along with three miles of microscopic wiring and 523 million synapses connecting them. The project aims to better understand brain function and potentially lead to treatments for diseases like Alzheimer's.

question_sentence: Which Britpop act announced plans to release its first new album in a quarter of a century?
evidence: Twenty-five years after the release of "We Love Life", "More" will drop on 6 June. The band marked the news by releasing a new track called "Spike Island", their first release since 2013. Speaking to BBC Radio 6 Music, frontman Jarvis Cocker said the album came about following the band's reunion tour in 2023.

question_sentence: Which athlete had a Ken doll made in his likeness by Mattel?
evidence: The Los Angeles Lakers basketball star made history as the first professional male athlete to have a Ken doll made of him. The mini James sports his pre-game fashion and is an inch taller than the standard Ken doll.

question_sentence: Which country is home to the world's best airport, according to a recent survey from Skytrax?
evidence: Singapore Changi has been crowned the World’s Best Airport for the 13th time.

question_sentence: Sleep researchers say which mental trick will help you fall asleep?
evidence: Cognitive shuffling “takes your mind off of your problems and your issues, and helps you get into a more relaxed state of mind,” said Dr. Fariha Abbasi-Feinberg.

question_sentence: Which basketball team won the women’s NCAA tournament national championship game?
evidence: UConn beat defending champion South Carolina 82-59 to win its 12th national title.

question_sentence: Which British pop star was recently diagnosed with scurvy?
evidence: Robbie Williams was diagnosed with scurvy, which he described as a “17th century pirate disease.”

question_sentence: Which of the following, often called the “silent killer,” has recently been tied to the deaths of several Americans traveling abroad?
evidence: Carbon monoxide has no taste, odor or color, yet prolonged inhalation of the invisible gas can be deadly.

question_sentence: Why did the US Naval Academy remove 381 books from the Nimitz Library?
choices: Content about race, gender and sexuality
evidence: The removal reinforces the Trump administration’s clamp down on diversity, equity and inclusion efforts in the federal government.

question_sentence: Alex Ovechkin scored 895 goals, surpassing Wayne Gretzky as the NHL’s all-time leading scorer. Which team does he play for?
evidence: Ovechkin is the captain of the Washington Capitals.

question_sentence: The NBA fined Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant $75,000 for making which symbol with his fingers during a game?
evidence: Morant was previously warned by the league not to make a gun gesture with his fingers.

question_sentence: What animal has been terrorizing an English village for weeks?
evidence: The male Harris’ Hawk was captured on Thursday, ending a string of around 50 attacks.

question_sentence: The National Weather Service is ending which of the following?
evidence: The weather service has “paused” translations because its contract with the provider has lapsed.
